Enjoy flavours of raspberry, cherry and spice with earthy and spicy oak notes on the finish.
Brand: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery
Recomm_foods: ['Tortello alla Trattoria Monti', 'Lamb Leg', "Shepherd's Pie"]

Name: Henry of Pelham Speck Family Reserve Baco Noir
Description: Baco Noir is grown virtually exclusively in Canada, and Henry of Pelham is home to some of the very best expressions. This example is concentrated and generously flavoured, with dancing raspberry and blackberries supported by herbs, smoke, earth, beet, and oak spice. This wants big meaty meals; think barbecued flank steak, bison burgers or lamb kebabs.
Brand: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery

Name: Henry of Pelham Speck Family Reserve Cabernet/Merlot 2015
Description: This terrific Niagara Cabernet Merlot blend is nearly a 50-50 split between the two grapes, all of which were hand-picked grapes from the most mature Speck Family Estate vineyards. Low-yield vines concentrate the wine flavours. The wine was then aged for 20 months in French oak barrels. Aromas of cassis and blackcurrant. Needs cellar time and 1-2 hours decanting. Pair with rare steak. Drink: 2018-2025. Score - 93. (Natalie MacLean, nataliemaclean.com, May 23, 2018)
Brand: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery

Name: Henry Of Pelham Speck Family Reserve Pinot Noir 2016
Description: The top-tier Pinots from the Speck brothers are sourced from the oldest estate vineyards on the Short Hills Bench that were planted in 1988. The warm vintage has given this wine fantastic concentration of dark cherries, cassis, wild raspberry and currants with earthy/brambly notes, violets and elegant oak spices on the nose. It's all about the integrated red and dark fruits, even at this early stage, that are juicy yet poised and polished and meld perfectly with the oak spices. It's all delivered on a bed of silky smooth tannins through a long finish. Lovely Pinot that will be ready to rock when released. Score - 92. (Rick VanSickle, winesinniagara.com, Feb. 1, 2018)
Brand: Henry Of Pelham Family Est. Winery

Name: Henry's Drive Vignerons Magnus Shiraz 2013
Description: Generous, fresh and vibrant, with notes of spearmint and milk chocolate adding richness and depth to a core of black cherry and wild blueberry flavors. A touch of black licorice lingers on the finish, with velvety tannins. Drink now through 2030. 533 cases made.  Score - 93. (MaryAnn Worobiec, winespectator.com, April 30, 2017)

Name: Henschke Cyril Henschke Cabernet Sauvignon/Cabernet Franc/Merlot 2012
Description: 79% cabernet sauvignon, 15% cabernet franc, 7% merlot, vinified separately, matured in French hogsheads (38% new) for 18 months. This is one of Australia's greatest cabernets, staring down Coonawarra and Margaret River (just for starters). The argument evaporates when you admit - as you must - that those wines are in such different styles it's an apples and oranges comparison. The real comparison is between this and Mount Mary. It has a purity and elegance that puts it in a class of its own. Drink By: 2039.  Score - 97. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Oct. 6, 2016)

Name: Henschke Henry's Seven 2014
Description: Shiraz takes the lead here, with Grenache, Viognier and Mataro playing supporting roles in this deep ruby blend. Aromas of plum, blackberry, with hints of white flowers, lavender and black pepper inform the nose while the palate displays raspberry and dark plum fruits. Lively acidity and soft tannins provide texture for a long, structured finish.

Name: Henschke Hill of Grace Shiraz 2012
Description: Medium to deep garnet colored, the 2012 Shiraz Hill of Grace is a little reticent on the nose to begin, opening out to a somewhat paradoxically tantalizing black forest cake, beef dripping, fertile loam and tree bark nose with hints of black pepper, Marmite, bay leaves, eucalyptus, licorice and baker's chocolate. The medium to full-bodied palate is a wonderfully intricate mélange of mineral, savory, dark fruits and spice layers, framed by velvety tannins and refreshing acidity, finishing epically. This is a truly great Hill of Grace that has just entered the first stage of its drinking window and should continue to develop beautifully over the next 25+ years. Drink 2019-2035. Score - 99. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2017)

Name: Henschke Keyneton Euphonium 2014
Description: Valentine's day delivered over five inches of rain and, with a spring frost, scythed yields. Seamless tannins and a great saturation of sweet blood plum and inky black and blue fruits make for a lingering finish, with a kiss of five spice and graphite joined by an attractive hint of green. This unusually elegant Barossa Shiraz Cabernet Merlot blend spent 18 months in French and American oak hogsheads, 15% new. Drinking window: 2018-2028. Score - 93. (Sarah Ahmed, decanter.com, July 3, 2018)

Name: Henschke Mount Edelstone Vineyard Shiraz 2015
Description: This was the first wine sold in bottle ('52) by Henschke, although it has had to play second fiddle to Grange since '58 when the latter came on stream. New oak is only 22%, and the majority of the oak is French. The vintage was excellent, the flavours deep, with soft blackberry and plum fruits wending their way across the palate, cushioned by cedary oak and carefully polished tannins. It's utterly classic drinking, with unalloyed pleasure now but no less in another 20 years. Drink by: 2047. Score - 97. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2019)

Name: Herdade da Farizoa Grande Reserva 2013
Description: The 2013 Grande Reserva (Herdade da Farizoa) is mostly Syrah, with 15% Aragonez and 5% Touriga Nacional, all aged for 20 months in 50% new French barriques. It comes in at 15% alcohol. If the regular 2013 Reserva this issue showed a fair bit of wood, this does as well, but it handles it better. There is a touch of coconut added in but it also adds more power, concentration and focus. The mid-palate does a rather good job of soaking up the wood. There is also an uptick in price here over the regular Reserva but if you can afford the tab it's worth it. The Reserva is lovely and has a good chance of getting better with cellaring. This definitely will improve. It should really be given a year or two in the cellar at least. It will likely show far better around 2020. Drink Date: 2018-2030.  Score - 92+. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2017)

Name: Herdade da Pimenta Touriga Nacional/Touriga Franca/Alicante Bouschet 2013
Description: Serious wood aging has given this concentrated wine power and great aging potential. For now, it is firmly tannic, but rich black fruit tones and juicy acidity are there, waiting to develop. It will be an impressive wine after 2018. Editors' Choice. Score - 92. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Aug. 2015)

Name: Herdade de Farizoa Reserva 2014
Description: Hugely dense and with firm tannins, this concentrated wine shows great structure as well as great fruits. Its powerful licorice and black-chocolate flavors contrast with the opulent black-plum fruits. The wine can be drunk now, but will be even better from 2020. Cellar Selection. Score - 93. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Feb. 1, 2019)

Name: Herdade Grande Gerações Colheita Seleccionada 2013
Description: A celebration of the generation that has run the estate, this wine is powerful and firmly structured. Made for long-term aging, it's packed with dusty tannins and dense, juicy blackberry fruit and has a concentrated aftertaste. Still developing, it will be ready from 2019. Score - 92. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, May 1, 2017)

Name: Herdade São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Tinto 2017
Description: The 2017 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Tinto is a 50/30 blend of Alicante Bouschet and 30% Touriga National, with Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon filling out the blend. It was aged for six months in used French oak and comes in at 14% alcohol. Only in bottle about two weeks when seen, this still showed better than the 2017 Cicónia Reserva. Dense, deep and very rich for this level - seemingly richer than I've seen in the past - this is an intriguing regular red this year. For all of the good fruit, the structure is still modest. I'd like to see more evidence this can develop a bit, which would turn it into a steal instead of merely a fine bargain. Of course, given the modest price, this is not a risky decision. At worst, it's a lot of fun. It is worth leaning up on this for the moment. Drink Date: 2018-2027.  Score - 88. (Mark Squires, robertparker.com, Aug. 31, 2018)

Name: Heritance Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: Aromas of currants and fresh herbs with hints of tobacco. Full body, ripe fruit and a soft and velvety finish. Drink in 2019. Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Jan. 26, 2017)

Name: Hermanos Peciña Finca Iscorta de Peciña Gran Reserva 2010
Description: The 2010 Finca Iscorta De Peciña Gran Reserva is their usual blend of Tempranillo with 3% Garnacha and 2% Graciano, sourced from 50-year-old vines from their Finca Iscorta vineyard in the Sonsierra zone; therefore, it is a single-vineyard bottling. It fermented with indigenous yeasts and aged in well-seasoned American oak barrels for 48 months with manual and gravity rackings every six months. This feels very harmonious, combining some primary notes with more-developed tertiary aromas. The palate also reveals a rare mix of power and elegance that only the very best vintages are capable of. It has polished tannins, good volume, freshness and length. Drink or hold, there should be no rush. Drink Date: 2018-2030. Score - 94+. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Feb. 28, 2018)

Name: Hermanos Peciña Señorío de P. Peciña Gran Reserva 2009
Description: There is one more exceptional red with an extended aging in barrel that was only produced in 1998, 2001 and 2003, and now in this 2009 Señorío de P. Peciña Gran Reserva. It is the usual Tempranillo with 3% Garnacha and 2% Graciano, but in this case from 50-year-old vines from their Finca Iscorta vineyard in the Sonsierra zone. The wine is aged in well-seasoned American oak barrels for four years with manual and gravity racking twice per year. If the nose could somehow remind you of the 2009 Reserva, this is more open and aromatic, more nuanced, and the palate also shows a level of complexity and refinement that makes it much more enjoyable, with polished tannins and great length. While it's not a wimp, it doesn't overload your senses. A great and classical Gran Reserva. Drink Date: 2016-2024. Score - 94. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Aug. 30, 2016)

Name: Hermanos Peciña Señorío de P. Peciña Reserva
Herve Bizeul Côtes du Roussillon 2017
Description: 92 pts Wine Advocate ''A super tank-aged red from Bizeul, the 2017 Les Sorcieres is 50% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 10% Carignan. More garrigue-influenced than his Domaine de la Chique, this boasts the same blueberries and cherries but adds that extra layer of complexity to the mix. This medium to full-bodied wine is silky and long and should represent a terrific value.'

Name: Herzog Lineage Camouflage 2015
Description: There's no hiding the fact that this red will match fluently with a range of robust dishes. Nuances of leather, anise and toasted nuts integrate with upfront cherry and blackberry. Traces of delicate sweetness and floral notes give the overarching boldness that much more personality.

Name: Herzog Variations American Oak Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: The anticipation of a hearty feast always brings with it the prospect of finding that perfect pairing - which should find you securing this superlative option. Captivating berry fruit, both black and red, tug this into unreservedly rich territory, as shades of dill and soothing vanilla grow on the finish.

Name: Herzog Variations Four Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Description: Here's to poise and great presence, and finding that perfect pairing for the roast that is going into the pan tonight. Layers of plum, blackberry, coffee and anise combine with a distinct note of oak to dispense a long, firm and flavourfully complex finish.

Name: Herència Altés L'Estel 2016
Description: Crafted from Garnacha, Syrah and Carignan grapes grown in mountainous Terra Alta, this red is a standout for its deep colour and full body. With black fruit and spice aromas, soft tannins and a long, tasty finish, it's made for grilled meat.

Name: Hess Collection Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: This blend of 85 per cent cabernet sauvignon with touches of petite sirah, malbec, petit verdot and merlot, has a ripe-plum and blackberry core that delivers sweetly attractive and fresh into the finish. Drink or hold.  Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 19, 2018)

Name: Hess Select Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Since the 1990s, Hess has been a source of exceptional, refined Cabernet. The Select portfolio comprises Hess's entry-level wines. This Cabernet always strikes that fine balance between power and elegance. Dark fruit, spice, cloves, a moderately applied underlying vanilla tone and a velvety texture are at the heart of why this popular wine is such a reliable value-priced offering that consistently over-delivers. Pair it with grilled lamb or beef.

Name: Hewitson Baby Bush Mouverdre 2014
Description: Proving that Barossa is not just about Shiraz, this purple-hued Mourvèdre (from a vineyard planted in 1853) shows complex aromatics of leather, wood spices, red licorice, graphite, plums and Mediterranean herbs. The savoury palate is medium- to full-bodied with texture from the fleshy tannins and a smooth, silky finish.

Name: Hewitson Minimal Intervention Tempranillo 2015
Description: Putting an Australian accent on Spain's signature red grape results in a beautiful purple-crimson hued wine lush with the dark berry fruits. Black cherry and liquorice aromas blend with fresh cedar and spice flavours. Lasagna, lamb chops or thin slices of lomo would all make fine pairings for this food-friendly red.

Name: Hewitson Miss Harry 2015
Description: A light, brilliantly coloured blend of grenache, shiraz, mourvedre, cinsaut and carignan. A finely wrought and balanced wine with just about every spice and every red berry you can imagine from this Southern Rhone blend. A truly wonderful trattoria wine that soars on the gently savoury finish. Drink By: 2030. Score - 95. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Nov. 1, 2017)

Name: Hewitt Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: Made from 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, the 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon has a deep garnet-purple color and fragrant nose of cedar, violets, potpourri and crushed blueberries over a core of black currants and plums, plus a hint of dusty earth. Medium to full-bodied, the palate reveals impressive energy, with tons of perfumed black fruit and earthy layers supported by firm, grainy tannins, finishing long and lively. 2,300 cases were made. Drink Date: 2020-2045. Score - 95. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2017)

Name: Hex Vom Dasenstein Pinot Noir QBA Dry 2015
Description: This is a perfectly elegant option that will pair effortlessly with a range of robust seasonal dishes. A full-bodied red, it shows a depth of dark cherry and bright redcurrant flavours with a gratifyingly dry finish.

Name: Hickinbotham Cabernet Sauvignon 2010
Description: Very deep purple-black in color, the 2010 Hickenbotham Cabernet Sauvignon is intensely scented of creme de cassis, blackberry preserves and plum compote with touches of menthol, cloves and dark chocolate. Full-bodied and richly fruited in the mouth with tons of black fruit, Chinese five spice and earth flavor layers supported by firm, finely grained tannins and lively acid, it finishes with great length. Drink it 2014 to 2024+. Score - 94+. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Feb. 27, 2013)

Name: Hickinbotham Clarendon Vineyard Brooks Road Shiraz 2015
Description: In a word, breathtaking. Yes it's powerful, richly flavoured and full-bodied but the angel is in the detail. Black-crimson-purple same as the fruit notes within flecked with bay leaves, dark chocolate with cinnamon spice. The oak is neatly tucked in, the tannins plump and slightly grainy with exceptional length. Special Value. Drink By: 2033. Score - 96. (Jane Faulkner, winecompanion.com.au,  Aug. 1, 2017)

Name: Hidden Bench Estate Organic Pinot Noir
Description: Hidden Bench will not release any wine that does not meet their exacting expectations. Their estate Pinot comes from select parcels from their three estate vineyards. Elegant and refined cherry, herb and mineral notes. Try this with bacon-stuffed mushrooms.
Recomm_foods: ['Green Beans with Shiitakes & Onions', 'Mushroom Sugo Tofu', 'Beef Stew With Greek Flavours']

Name: Hidden Bench Terroir Caché 2015
Description: It is not common to see successful Bordeaux reds grown on escarpment sites, but this is an exception and perhaps a tribute to HB's detailed viticulture and winemaking. It's a blend of 36% cabernet franc, 34% merlot and a surprising 24% malbec. It shows deep colour, lovely floral, blackberry fruit (thanks malbec), vanillin and spice. It is quite elegant, even svelte, and fairly dense with good acidity and fine, firm tannin. Excellent length. Best 2019 to 2025. Score - 92. (David Lawrason, winealign.com, March 14, 2018)

Name: Hidden Story Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Really coming into its own, this vibrant Cabernet Sauvignon displays rich blackberry, blackcurrant and violet aromas. In the glass there's a wonderful balance between fine silky tannins and a smooth finish. Ready to drink now, try pairing it with garlic and rosemary roasted lamb leg or teriyaki chicken wings.

Name: Hidden Story Merlot 2014
Description: This wine is a deep garnet colour with a nose that displays luscious blackberry aromas that lead to plum and dark berry fruit flavours balanced with subtle spice. The soft tannins help to shape the wine's smooth, velvety finish. This is a wine that pairs really well with all-dressed cheeseburgers and BBQ.

Name: Hidden Story Shiraz 2013
Description: Copper red and luminous, this classic Australian Shiraz offers rich blackberry and cherry aromas with a touch of spiciness on the palate. Bold and extroverted, it looks for food with equally big flavours: charcuterie, meatloaf with caramelized onions or orange and honey glazed duck would all work beautifully.

Name: Hillier Creek Gamay Noir 2017
Description: Canada is one of the few locations where Gamay excels. These light, food-friendly wines are easy options for summer alfresco dining. This one is floral with oodles of cherry, plum and baking spice tones. Crisp and fresh, it's ideal for casual picnic-style foods. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2018)

Name: Hilvan Crianza DO Rioja 2015
Description: Fresh and inviting Tempranillo here with lovely sour cherry notes over top of spice and herbs. Nice structure and great finish.

Name: Hilvan Riserva DOC Rioja 2011
Description: Classic Rioja notes of cherry and vanilla meet stewed red fruits, beautiful coconut flavours and a touch of dill in this mouth-watering wine. It's sensational alongside coconut curries or jerk chicken.

Name: Hinterbrook Nomad Pinot Noir 2016
Description: It's always a joy to find Pinot Noir with spot-on varietal character at such a reasonable price. Bright cherry and raspberry are joined by hints of underbrush and mushrooms, all in good balance. This Nomad is something to write home about, especially when paired with roast beef sandwiches and grainy mustard. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2018)

Name: Hipster Negroamaro Puglia IGT 2017
Description: Cosmopolitan and sporty, I am liked for my structure and freshness as well as my bouquet which recalls notes of sweet violet and small red fruits.

Name: Hitching Post Hometown Pinot Noir 2016
Description: This wine was grown in vineyards in Santa Barbara and San Luis Obispo. According to the winery, the 2016 vintage was particularly good for making balanced Pinot Noir. This one proves the point with its notions of dark cherry, dark chocolate, earth and spice and its lovely, delicate style. Savour it with roast beef and braised root vegetables. (Vintages panel, June 2018)

Name: Hob Nob Pinot Noir Pays D'OC
Description: bright ruby colour with pink rim; cherry and raspberry aromas; dry, medium body; juicy ripe berry flavour with medium finish
Recomm_foods: ['Cheddar Mashed Potatoes', 'Green Curry Chicken Satay', 'Flank Steak with Kale and Bulgur Salad']

Name: Hob Nob Wicked Red Limited Edition
Hogue Genesis Meritage 2015
Description: A blend of Merlot, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon with a quarter of the wine matured in American oak. This suggests violets and cassis with subtle notions of black olive, sweet plum, mocha, mint and vanilla. It's rich and expansive enough to stand up to filet mignon with grilled root veggies and Parmesan sweet potatoes, but will also be right at home with grilled burgers. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2018)

Name: Hogue Genesis Syrah 2015
Description: In the beginning, this Genesis was grown in the appellations of Horse Heaven Hills (88.5%), Snipes Mountain (9.5%) and Yakima Valley. It's brimming with blueberry, blackberry and black cherry wrapped in a soft, supple texture and will make a great pairing for beef tenderloin, or duck breast in a tangy red-wine-and-blueberry sauce. (Vintages panel, April 2018)

Name: Homs Gravieres de Sancastel 2016
Description: Domaine des Homs works in an eco-responsible way and has been certified organic for a long time. This special cuvée is nothing more than a little gem coming from a terraced cultivation that magnifies the exceptional grape variety Syrah with a result which is both intense and velvety.

Name: Honey Badger Luscious Red
Description: Medium ruby colour; smoky, chocolate covered cherries and violet aromas with a woody, caramel note; sweet blackberry jam flavours with a hint of mocha; medium-bodied and fruity.
Recomm_foods: ['Chicken Liver Mousse Crostini with Marinated Blackberries', 'Duck Fattouch', 'Currant-Glazed Duck Breast Raspberry-Chipotle Sauce']

Name: Honoro Vera Garnacha Calatayud DO
Description: Deep ruby in colour this fragrant red offers aromas of blackberry, plum, and mulberry tea. The palate is dry and medium-bodied with balanced acid and tannins; look for flavours of ripe strawberry, blueberry, earth and savoury herbs followed by a long and spicy finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Tomahawk Steak with Grilled Wild Mushrooms', 'Porcini, Herb & Cauliflower Soup', 'Horseradish Grilled Steak and Potato Salad']

Name: Hoopes Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: From the 10 acre estate vineyard in Oakville, cropped at quite low yields, this wine has a full aroma of black fruit and peppery spice. The palate is expansive and rich, with violet tinged cassis, menthol, fried herb, wood and peppery spice. There's a nice tar and liquorice and chocolate and coffee bean mid-palate leading into a long finish carried by a wave of raspberry acidity. Needs time. Drinking Window: 2017-2027. Score - 93. (James Button, decanter.com, Dec. 13, 2017)

Name: Hopes End Red Blend
Description: The Angove family named this blend of shiraz, grenache and malbec to commemorate their family patriarch's reaction upon arriving in 1886 Australia?hopes' end. Aromas of spice, leather and blackberry jam precede flavours of ripe blackberry, cherry and a hint of vanilla. The finish is smooth. Enjoy with a grilled steak.
Recomm_foods: ['Advieh-Spiced Steak Sandwich', 'Beef Bourguignon', 'Porterhouse Steak']

Name: Hourglass Blueline Estate Merlot 2014
Description: An enthralling release, overflowing with dark cherry, plum and blackberry juiciness, its deeper shades of hoisin and a compact minerality lend even more complexity as the flavours progress. It's silky, smooth and simply superb.

Name: House of Mandela Phumla Pinotage 2017
Description: The Mandelas are the descendants of a royal bloodline that dates back to the 18th century, when Thembuland was part of the royal kingdom of the Eastern Cape. This wine was matured in stainless steel on French oak staves for 10 months and offers smoky and savoury herbs, cocoa, blue plum and blackberry wrapped in plush, velvety tannins. Pair with back ribs in a spiced dry rub. (Vintages panel, Oct. 2018)

Name: House of Plantagenet Pinot Noir 2017
Description: Complex cherry notes, morello and sour cherry, dominate the nose and palate. Rose petal, black raspberry, spiced cherry, dry mocha and dark cacao. Elegant but firm, ripe savoury tannin gives good support to fruit weight, medium plus acidity adds to the ageing potential of this wine. Youthful with a bright future ahead.

Name: Howard Park Flint Rock Shiraz 2015
Description: Shiraz grown in both the Mt Barker and Frankland River areas of the Great Southern, almost in equal measure (slightly favouring FR). Yes. It hits the mark nicely. Plums, peppercorns, deli meat and creamy oak. Enough fruit, enough 'interest', a silky feel to the palate and just enough 'oomph'. No hesitation in going here. Drink: 2017-2025+. Score - 92. (Campbell Mattinson, winefront.com.au, Sept. 2017)

Name: Howard Park Miamup Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Well flavoured and well put together. Blackcurrant, gum leaf, a light spray of herbs and a chocolate-like note. The mid palate has a roundness to it, somewhat unusually for cabernet, but that will only please most red wine drinkers. Good volume. Good mouthfeel. Tick. Drink: 2017-2023+. Score - 90. (Campbell Mattinson, winefront.com.au, Sept. 2017)

Name: Howard Park Scotsdale Shiraz 2014
Description: The purple-crimson colour is excellent, the wine living up to that promise; the spicy/peppery bouquet leads into a medium to full-bodied palate, black fruits, licorice and pepper all on display. It is the structure of the tannins that clinch the deal: they are rounded and sewn into the fabric of the wine. This and the Leston are very different, but of equal quality. Drink By: 2044. Special Value. Score - 96. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Oct. 6, 2016)

Name: Hoya De Cadenas Reserva Tempranillo, Utiel-Requena DO
Description: Medium  garnet colour; ripe plum and red cherry aromas with a touch of cedar; dry, medium to full bodied; black cherry flavour withan earthy tone, balanced structured; firm tannins on finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Brisket from Barque Smokehouse', 'Spiced Short Ribs with Horseradish Butter', 'Chilorio Taco']

Name: Huarpe Agrelo Terroir Malbec/Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Description: Essence of Agrelo, this is a soft, approachable, easy drinking cuvée of Malbec with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon showing fine tannins, a grassy note, plenty of supple, juicy fruit and well integrated oak. Huarpe is a winery to watch in Mendoza. Drink Date: 2017-22. Score - 91. (Tim Atkin, MW, timatkin.com, Argentina 2017 Special Report)

Name: Hubert Lignier Les Poisets 2013
Description: Covering an area of 34 acres this old vineyard is located at the foot of the 'Les Cailles' Premier Crus. Produced from a small crop affected by millerandage (very small grapes of varying sizes), the wine has a dark red hue and scents of violets and blackberries.
Brand: Prestige Des Grands Vins De Fr

Name: Huff Estates South Bay Vineyards Cabernet Franc 2016
Description: Sourced from the clay, shale and limestone of the South Bay Vineyard, which was first planted in 2011, this offers up a wealth of ripe fruit. Look for black plums, blueberry and blackberry in particular, alongside peppery spice notes. Juicy and still a bit tight - lots more to come from this one - it will be perfect for grilled meats or (if you can wait) a hearty meat stew this fall. (Vintages panel, March 2018)

Name: Hugh Hamilton Jekyll & Hyde Shiraz/Viognier 2015
Description: A 93/7% blend, the shiraz vines dating back to '47, the adjacent viognier of much newer origin. The two varieties are picked together and co-fermented with a 3-day cold soak, 6-day ferment and 5-day post-ferment maceration, matured for 17 months in French (23% new) and 2% new American oak. This is full-bodied, but moves deftly across the palate in a continuous stream of black fruits, dark chocolate and cedar, the tannins ripe and synchronous. Drink By: 2035.  Score - 95. (James Halliday, winecompanion.com.au, Aug. 1, 2017)

Name: I Balzi Rosso 2016
Description: [The Berliner Wein Trophy competition did not include a tasting note.] Score - Gold. (Berliner Wein Trophy, 2018)

Name: I Castei Campo Casalin Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2013
Description: A fine and creamy red that ripples with pureed black cherry and raspberry fruit and mocha and spicy mineral notes. Well-knit and focused, framed by elegant tannins that firm the finish. Drink now through 2030. Score - 92. (Alison Napjus, winespectator.com, July 31, 2017)

Name: I Diavoli Sangiovese Superiore 2016
Description: This devilishly delicious wine is sourced from an area close to the Onferno ('Inferno,' in antiquity) Nature Reserve. The area was named for the presence of steaming fumaroles and the dark, bat-filled caves that locals believed led to hell. The 2016 I Diavoli (the Devils) Sangiovese is crafted in a sinfully tasty New World style that puts great emphasis on the ripe red fruit. Smooth and balanced with fine tannins, a pleasing chalky minerality and a great food-friendly acidity. Get a big fork and fire up the grill.  (Vintages panel, June 2017)

Name: Icardi Barolo DOCG Parej
Description: Parej: 'In this way' - this is how Barolo wine should be, an assemblage of Nebbiolo grapes coming from 3 different areas. A racy style, featuring blueberry, black currant, violet, tar and spice flavours allied to a linear frame. Balanced and complex, building to a long, mineral-tinged and mouthwatering finish. Best from 2021 through 2036. 94 points Wine Spectator

Name: Icellars Estate Cabernet Franc 2016
Description: The 2016 vintage was one of the warmest and driest on record for the Niagara region, and it shows in the richness and depth of this wine. The Cabernet Franc is layered and complex with aromas of dark plums, toasty oak, pencil lead and smoke. The grapes are grown in the Wismer Foxcroft Vineyard. Long finish. Pair with grilled lamb. Score - 94. (Natalie MacLean, nataliemaclean.com, Aug. 30, 2018)

Name: Il Botolo Barbera D'Asti Superiore DOCG 2015
Description: Juicy cherry notes and a touch of mint lead the way in this captivating Barbera. Smooth, full-bodied and well-balanced, it is an ideal pairing for robust foods, from blue cheese to root vegetable dishes to rich meats.

Name: Il Cervo Toscana IGT 2010
Description: The bouquet is broad, elegant, a grand harmony with hints of vanilla and red berries.

Name: Il Conte Villa Prandone Zipolo IGP 2015
Description: On the palate the wine is well balanced and the tannins are firm. The palate matches the nose with respect to the fruit and herbal notes. There is a wonderful sweet, spicy presence in the lengthy, lingering finish.

Name: Il Marchesale Syrah Riserva IGT 2013
Description: This Tuscan winery matures their bold 100% syrah for eighteen months in French oak barriques. Complex aromas of black fruit, baking spice and cigar box lead to a robust palate of black berry, dried cranberry, clove and black pepper. Notes of dark chocolate appear on the long finish. Pair with dry-rubbed pork spareribs.

Name: Il Molino di Grace Chianti Classico 2014
Description: The 2014 Chianti Classico is a fairly dense wine for the year, with a good interplay of textural richness and aromatic lift, offering notes of black cherry, plum, lavender and spice. Perhaps even more importantly, some of the technical issues that have marred these wines in the past are absent. The 2014 is one of the best wines I have tasted from Il Molino di Grace in a number of years. Drinking window: 2017-2023. Score - 91. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Jan. 2018)

Name: Il Molino di Grace Riserva Chianti Classico 2014
Description: Cherry and black currant fruit is shaded by floral, tobacco and iron accents in this elegant red. Firm and juicy, with a lingering, chalky finish. Drink now through 2026.  Score - 91. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, Sept. 30, 2017)

Name: Il Palagio di Piccini Monia Chianti Classico Riserva DOCG 2014
Description: A wonderful Chianti aged in French oak barrels for 24 months and a further six months in bottle. Vibrant ruby red with pretty notes of cherry, raspberry and hints of spice. Finely structured and well-balanced this medium-bodied and flavourful wine has graceful tannins and a long-lasting finish. Serve with aged cheeses.
Brand: Az. Agr. Il Palagio Di Piccini Moni

Name: Il Palagio Message in a Bottle 2016
Description: Yum. So perfumed and pretty on the nose with Indian spices and ripe fruit, such as plums. Full-bodied yet focused and well-formed, showing firm yet fine tannins. A juicy finish. From biodynamically grown grapes. Drink in 2020. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Sept. 11, 2018)

Name: Il Palagio Sister Moon
Brand: Tenuta Il Palagio Srl Societa Agric

Name: Il Palazzino Stagi 2012
Description: The 2012 Stagi, Il Palazzino's 100% Colorino, is fabulous. The tannins that are so common in Colorino are nicely domesticated, while the ripe, racy fruit of the vintage comes through nicely. Super-ripe red cherry, plum, rose petal and exotic spice notes build into the flamboyant finish. Even with all of its intensity, the 2012 is a midweight wine with a lot of emphasis on structure. I loved it.  Score - 94. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, Jan. 2018)

Name: Il Paradiso di Frassina Moz Art Brunello di Montalcino 2012
Description: Such a beautiful Brunello with strawberry and plum character. Hints of roses and lemons. Medium to full body, lovely fine tannins and a cream and fruity finish. Subtle and pretty. Drink now or hold. Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Nov. 30, 2016)

Name: Il Passo Verde Nero D'Avola Organic, Sicilia DOC
Description: From their vineyards in southwestern Sicily, this nero d'avola is made using organically grown grapes. It is aged for 6 months; 50% in barriques and 50% in concrete tanks. Expect aromas and flavours of plum, cherry, pepper and flower. Medium-bodied and fruity with a dry finish, this is a friendly pairing for pizza.
Recomm_foods: ['Lamb on a Bed of Herbs', 'Curried Lamb and Potato Pot Pie', 'Baked Lamb Samosas']

Name: Il Pollenza 2010
Description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, the 2010 Il Pollenza is a wine of beauty and depth. The Marche region is not known for wines of this power and character, but the Il Pollenza estate seems intent on making a big statement. The Bordeaux choice of grapes - as opposed to using indigenous varieties - gives the wine a clearly international blueprint. The wine is deeply saturated and rich with dark fruit and plenty of spice. I prefer the 2009 vintage to this wine, but not by much. This wine is impressive based on its own merits. Drink date: 2017-2027.  Score - 93. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, March 30, 2016 )

Name: Il Sestante Amarone della Valpolicella 2013
Description: Tommasi is one of the most respected, revered winemakers in Italy. The Il Sestante is named for the sextant, which is a nautical navigation aide. This is a classic wine from a classic producer, named for a classic method of knowing exactly where you are as you move from point A to point B. And if your particular point B from point A is to have enjoyed a wonderful meal of braised beef or venison, then this intense, balanced wine, with its ripe cherry tones and underlying coffee notes, will easily show you the way. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2017)

Name: Iliada Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
Description: Vegan and organic, with jammy fruit, peach and berry aromas, plus toasted and spicy notes, this velvety Cabernet from the Valencia region features soft, creamy tannins and a long finish. It's an elevated match for burgers.

Name: Illuminati Riparosso Mont D'Abruzzo DOC
Description: Deep ruby; cherry and plum aromas with sweet spicy notes; balanced fruit and oak flavours; medium to full-bodied.
Recomm_foods: ['Mini Burgers', 'Lamb and Apricots Kebabs', 'Blackened Lamb']

Name: Imperfecto 2012
Description: Pi first made the Iscay Cabernet Franc and Malbec blend in 2008, and his affinity for this partnership shows in his personal label. Fleshy black fruit notes, peppery spice and a long, rolling finish. Drinking Window: 2018-2025. Score - 95. (Amanda Barnes, decanter.com, June 16, 2018)

Name: Imperial Gran Reserva 2011
Description: I'm always looking forward to tasting CVNE's Gran Reserva bottlings, especially the 2011 Imperial Gran Reserva, as the year was highly praised, and I was very curious to see how it behaved. It's a classical blend of Tempranillo with 10% Graciano and 5% Mazuelo that matured in barrel for two years. It has good depth and complexity in the nose, nicely layered, very balsamic and tertiary. It feels elegant and harmonious. The palate is surprisingly fresh and vibrant, with finesse, freshness, fine and mostly resolved tannins and a fine thread of acidity that holds and lifts up the finish. Drink Date: 2018-2028.  Score - 93+. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Feb. 28, 2018)

Name: Imprevisto Red Wine 2015
Description: A bold Algarve red blend with the aroma of red berries and a touch of floral blossoms, this table wine has softer tannins that make it a good match for spiced duck breast or roasted chicken thighs.

Name: In Situ Signature Wines Syrah/Mourvèdre/Viognier 2016
Description: The red blend 2016 In Situ Signature Wines Syrah-Mourvèdre-Viognier contains 55% Syrah, 40% Mourvèdre and 5% Viognier from vines planted at 860 meters in altitude. It doesn't show many differences from the other reds in the range. It was produced in a straightforward, easy-to-drink style, with a soft texture, balance and less balsamic notes than the previous vintage I tasted. Drink Date: 2018-2021. Score - 89. (Luis Gutiérrez, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2018)

Name: Incendi 2013
Description: Dark ruby colour, good aromatic concentration with ripe black fruit, suggesting jam, blended with some spices. The palate is intense, velvety and complex, with round but firm tannins, with a persistent final in the mouth.

Name: Inception Deep Layered Red
Description: Medium ruby; aromas of ripe dark fruit, plum and spice are detected; the palate is medium body and off-dry showing flavours of bramble fruit along with mocha and spice, supple tannins and a medium finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Seared Beef & Spinach Panzanella Salad with Feta Dressing', 'Cashew & Peppered Beef Salad on a Bed of Endive', 'Curried Lamb Shanks']

Name: Incerti Amarone Della Valpolicella 2015
Description: Dark ruby almost black colour with an incredible array of aromas, including plum, blackberry, blueberry, black cherry, tobacco, chocolate coffee, smoke and leather. The palate is full, rich and ripe, with well balanced low acidity. Flavours of plum, blackberry, blueberry, black cherry replay the nose. The finish is long and satisfying. This is a vino meditazione!

Name: Incerti Ripasso San Rocco
Description: Deep ruby colour with intense aromas of red cherries, wild berries, red currants, licorice and cardamom. The palate is full yet lively with a good level of acidity. Tannins are present but nicely ripe and help to fill out the body. The finish is long and toasty.

Name: Indomita Gran Reserva Pinot Noir 2016
Description: A red with tangy fruit and spices. Hints of flowers. Medium to full body and fine tannins. Clean finish. Drink now. Score - 91. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, May 29, 2017)

Name: Indómita Duette Premium Cabernet Sauvignon/Carmenère 2016
Description: (Translated from the Spanish) The Maipo Costa is not as well-known as the Maipo Alto, the traditional Andean area for Chilean cabernet. This is a blend of 60% Cabernet and 40% Carmenère and comes from the granite soils of Longovilo, north of Rapel Lake, in the southernmost area of the Maipo Valley, about 50 kilometers from the sea. Not many cabernets are made here, but those that we have tried show soft notes of red fruits and excellent texture that feels nice and juicy with a lot of floral notes, not a common trait for Chilean cabernet, as well as considerable subtlety. Score - 93. (Patricio Tapia, Descorchados, 2019)

Name: Inglenook 1882 Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: The 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon 1882 is a delicious entry-level wine from Inglenook. Plump, juicy and voluptuous in the glass, the 1882 is done in a forward, fruit-driven style that will deliver considerable pleasure now and over the next few years. Drinking window: 2017-2024. Score - 92. (Antonio Galloni, vinous.com, March 2018)

Name: Inglenook Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: The 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon, which is a blend of 93% Cabernet Sauvignon and the rest Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, is a beauty of classicism and balance. Dense purple in color, with notes of crème de cassis, blackberry, cedar wood and forest floor, the wine is full-bodied, beautifully concentrated and pure, with moderate tannins and the potential for 20-25 years of upside. Drink Date: 2016-2041.  Score - 92. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2016 )

Name: Inglenook Rubicon 2014
Description: The proprietary red, the 2014 Rubicon (96% Cabernet Sauvignon and the rest Merlot and Petit Verdot) has a saturated black/purple color and a nose of blackberry and cassis with some camphor and charcoal. Chewy, rich and full-bodied, with exceptional precision and personality, this is a stunningly delicious and complex wine with a good 25-30 years of further potential. It is the antithesis of the rustic, somewhat coarse reds that were made under the Rubicon moniker when Francis Ford Coppola first acquired the Inglenook estate. Kudos to him for making dramatic improvements. Approachable already, this wine won't hit its stride for another decade and will last 30 or more years. Drink Date: 2016-2046. Score - 95+. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2016)

Name: Inniskillin Baco Noir VQA
Description: Part of their Niagara estate series, this baco noir shines with delight. Filled with rich dark berry notes, look for blackberry, cherry and hints of spice. Fresh and flavourful on the palate with more rich berry flavours, smooth texture supported by supple tannins and a pleasant finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Kofte with Creamy Sesame-Parsley Drizzle', 'Luxury Burger with Stilton, Caramelized Shallots and Balsamic Mushrooms', 'Lamb Meatballs with Roasted Peppers & Olives']

Name: Inniskillin Cabernet Merlot VQA
Description: Medium deep ruby; aromas and flavours of oak, cassis, plum, blackberry jam, vanilla and cedar; dry, medium bodied with good depth of fruit, structured tannins and good length.
Recomm_foods: ['Oven-Roasted Herbed Leg of Lamb', 'Lamb Tagine with Apples', 'Soup Joumou']

Name: Inniskillin East West Series Merlot Cabernet
Inniskillin Merlot VQA
Description: deep ruby colour; plum, red currant and soft spice aromas; dry, medium body; rich cassis and plum flavours, well balanced with firm tannins that could age 3 to 5 years
Recomm_foods: ['Beef Burgers with Grilled Mushrooms and Jarlsberg', 'Miniature Veal, Basil and Black Peppercorn Burgers', 'Tandoori Rack of Lamb']

Name: Inniskillin Montague Vineyard Pinot Noir 2013
Description: Nice characteristic aromas of raspberry and cherry, with some smoked meat and earth tones adding depth. Lean and taut, and crafted in an elegant style with sinewy supportive tannins. Enjoy with grilled beef, bison burgers or lamb.  (Vintages panel, July 2016)

Name: Inniskillin Okanagan Discovery Series Tempranillo 2015
Description: Intense red berry fruit aromas on the nose are complemented wonderfully by rich cherry and dark fruit flavours, with well integrated spicy oak notes and a long lingering finish. Try this boldly flavoured wine with various meat dishes, including roasted lamb, braised beef, or peppercorn steak.

Name: Inniskillin Okanagan Discovery Series Zinfandel 2015
Description: This wine displays beautiful red-violet in colour with intense ripe berry aromas on the nose complemented by hints of spicy oak. On the palate it has a great concentration of red fruits; cherry and prune. This is a rich, full bodied wine with a long smooth finish.

Name: Inniskillin Pinot Noir VQA
Description: Ruby red colour; aromas of raspberry, cherry fruit, mineral and earthy with a touch of vanilla and spice; dry medium bodied; shows good varietal character.
Recomm_foods: ['Carpaccio of Vegetables', 'Smoked Potato “Lasagna”', 'Rösti Benedict']

Name: Inniskillin Winemaker's Select Vineyards Pinot Noir 2010
Description: Medium ruby colour with a hint of garnet. Sour cherry, bramble and wild raspberry aromas accented by woodsmoke. Medium bodied, fleshy and concentrated Pinot that retains its elegance. Delicious, subtly smoky finish. Pair with seared tuna steaks, or venison chops in a red wine sauce. (Vintages panel, Nov. 2012)

Name: Insurgente Vinho Tinto 2015
Description: Rich, ripe and full of fruit, this blend of Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is generous and structured. It has dark tannins and concentrated black fruits (rich with wood aging), spice and fine acidity. Drink this full-bodied wine from 2018. Editors' Choice. Score - 91. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, Dec. 31, 2017)

Name: Intrinsic Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: A red with lots of sweet-tobacco and currant aromas and flavors. Medium to full body, round and juicy tannins and a flavorful finish. Harmonious and fine. Drink now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, May 16, 2018)

Name: Inurrieta Coral Rosado 2017
Description: With surprising summery aromas of pink grapefruit and white peach, and subtle mineral notes, this pale rosé from a young winery in Navarra is an elegant choice. Silky and delicate, it makes a light sipper and a nice partner to seafood.

Name: Inurrieta Cuatrocientos Crianza 2015
Description: From the northern region of Navarra comes this wonderfully fragrant, fruity red blend. With aromas of black and red berries, notes of cocoa, vanilla and cinnamon, and well-rounded tannins, it's a perfect choice for roast chicken or lasagna.

Name: Inurrieta Sensaciones 2017
Description: Cherry and redcurrant notes flow from the glass, combined with fine spices and a very subtle graphite note. The 3 month barrique maturation gives this wine perfect harmony and elegance.

Name: Inurrieta Sur 2016
Description: A bold red from the Navarra region in northern Spain, this blend of Syrah and Merlot grapes has distinct aromas of violet, berries and smoked wood. Its fruity notes and toasted oak character are ideal for roasted red meats or semi-mature cheeses.

Name: Irida Syrah Achaia PGI 2016
Description: Cavino winery, established in 1958, produces this wine in northwestern Greece (Achaia) in the mountains of Aegialia. The syrah has aromas and flavours of black and red fruits with a note of black pepper. The finish is velvety, full-bodied and fruity. Delicious paired with roasted meats, aged cheeses or red sauced pasta.

Name: Ironstone Merlot 2017
Description: California's wine scene is diverse, and regions such as Lodi are gold mines for seekers of vinous value. Case in point: this rich, ripe, smooth customer favourite. Nicely outlined dark berry and cherry tones combine with oak spice and mocha to create a pleasing, easy-to-enjoy Merlot. Its supple allure will go well with grilled ribs, sausages or burgers. (Vintages panel, July 2019)

Name: Ironstone Old Vine Zinfandel 2017
Description: Lodi is known for its old-vine Zinfandel, and this one is a great example of the style at a remarkably approachable price. This wine is grown on vines over 45 years old, and it's perennially popular among Vintages customers who appreciate its fruit-forward blackberry and blueberry flavours and soft, easygoing texture. Great with beef burritos, meat pies or burgers.

Name: Irony Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Produced by Jay and Chris Indelicato, this Cab is dry, full-bodied and deep ruby in the glass with plum, black cherry, raspberry, mint and dark chocolate flavours on the palate.  Score - 90. (Natalie MacLean, nataliemaclean.com, Jan. 3, 2019)

Name: Irvine Spring Hill Merlot 2016
Description: Beetle-shell black and just shy of opaque, this wine's nose evolves enticingly. Its initial scents are blackberry and black plum, while thirty to ninety minutes of air coaxes out additional aromas of cola, licorice and menthol. In an impressive acrobatic move, the full-bodied palate feels impressively buoyant thanks to the lifting acidity. Slightly gravelly tannins nicely counter the lightly gummy texture. There's a compelling umami meatiness and sanguine hint on the medium-plus finish that seems to demand dry-aged rib-eye, though with this lovely balance and excellent depth of character, it will pleasantly partner any cut of steak. Drink now-2022. Score - 93. (Wine Enthusiast Importer Connection, Feb. 2018)

Name: Isabel Ferrando Colombis Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2016
Description: A spitting image of the heavenly 2007, the 2016 Châteauneuf-du-Pape Colombis is a huge, opulent Grenache that delivers everything you could want from this variety. Layers of kirsch liqueur, garrigue, licorice, and herbes de Provence just cascade over the palate. This literal bomb of a wine is full-bodied, concentrated, and layered, yet like all truly great wines, it remains pure, balanced and graceful, with no sense of heaviness. It will most likely merit a triple-digit score in another 2-3 years and will keep for another 10-15 years, but why wait? Drink Date: 2021-2036.  Score - 99. (Jeb Dunnuck, jebdunnuck.com, Aug. 28, 2018)

Name: Isole e Olena Cepparello 2015
Description: Shows lots of black cherries, cranberry tea, caramelized orange peel, roasted herbs and citrus peel. Full-bodied with ripe and quite round tannins that frame layers of cherries. Bright and fresh, yet rich and long at the same time. The sangiovese character really springs out of the glass. Drink in 2020. Score - 96. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Sept. 11, 2018)

Name: Isole e Olena Chianti Classico 2015
Description: The 2015 Chianti Classico is a bright and convincing wine from Barberino Val d'Elsa, one of the main comuni in the greater Chianti Classico appellation. This is a smooth and silky Sangiovese that glides clean over the palate with strength and intensity. Bright cherry, blueberry and herbal accents with wild sage and rosemary characterize the finish. Like many other wines from the 2015 vintage, there is an evident touch of cherry sweetness on the close. Drink: 2017-2025. Score - 92. (Monica Larner, robertparker.com, Oct. 31, 2017)

Name: Italics Proprietary Red 2015
Description: The 2015 Italics Proprietary Red wine opens with cassis and raspberries. The mid-palate is rich and creamy, tempered by a fruit-based acidity. The mouthfeel has a graphite texture, intermingling with the mid-palate and delivering length and density to the finish. As a Bordeaux blend, it combines the softness of Merlot with the intensity of Cabernet Sauvignon, and seasoned with trace amounts of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc to give it layers of fruit and complexity. This wine will exceed your expectations, opening up beautifully, and delighting your senses.

Name: Izadi El Regalo 2014
Description: The fruit in this Rioja is still youthful and vibrant, layered with notes of mint and orange. The tannins are finely grained and there is this spectacular mocha richness on the finish, showing great potential to age. Drinking Window: 2017-2026. Score - 94. (Decanter, March 2017)

Name: Izadi Reserva 2014
Description: A generous plum, chocolate and earthy nose with subtle oak. Dry tannins are well integrated. An impressive modern wine. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, July 24, 2017)

Name: J. Bookwalter Readers Merlot 2015
Description: Gorgeous merlot with aromas and flavors of chocolate, blackberries, hazelnuts and almonds. Medium to full body, silky tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Drink or hold.  Score - 93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, May 16, 2018)

Name: J. Denuzière Côte Rotie 2014
Description: Deep, rich and surprisingly concentrated for a 2014, with gorgeous blackberry, plum, charred meats and crushed rock aromas and flavors, the 2014 J. Denuzière Côte Rotie is medium to full-bodied, layered and rich, with terrific length. It has ripe tannin, integrated acidity and I suspect will drink well for 10-12 years. Drink Date: 2016-2028.  Score - 93. (Jeb Dunnuck, robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2016)

Name: J. Hofstätter Meczan Pinot Nero 2015
Description: This Alto Adige Pinot Noir is brilliantly garnet coloured, fragranced like a woodland bouquet and bright with cherry and berry flavours. Fruity and mellow, it complements pesto- and herb-sauced meats and pastas.

Name: J. Lohr Carol's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: This blend of 79% Cabernet Sauvignon and 21% Petit Verdot has a densely opaque purple color, wonderfully sweet cassis fruit, blackberries and a floral note as well as a full-bodied, concentrated mouthfeel. In short, this is unquestionably the finest wine I have ever tasted from J. Lohr, so kudos to them. Drink it over the next 10-15 years. Drink Date: 2016-2031.  Score - 91. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2016 )

Name: J. Lohr Fog's Reach Pinot Noir 2014
Description: The quality for your money that J. Lohr delivers is quite impressive across the entire portfolio, and this bottling repeats the mantra, showing bold ripe cherry, rhubarb and lively oak spice over notes of damp earth and mushroom.  There's a nice citric pop at the end that balances the oak spice and keeps you coming back. Well done! Score - 92. (Rich Cook, winereviewonline.com, July 11, 2017)

Name: J. Lohr Los Osos Merlot
Description: Named for the Merlot-loving volcanic ash and andesite (a volcanic rock) of the vineyard, this remarkable value wine gains additional complexity and depth from the Malbec included in the blend. A rich, approachable and crowd-pleasing wine with smoky dark fruit wrapped in velvety tannins. Perfect for grilled lamb.
Recomm_foods: ['Orange Beef', '']

Name: J. Lohr Los Osos Merlot 2016
Description: Another vintage, another value from the J. Lohr Estates line. I can't think of another line of wines that will please a wide range of palates at this kind of price and availability. The Los Osos is generous with black fruit and spice, moderate oak toast and a pleasing finish that makes for a fine cocktail or a great grilling partner. Score - 90. (Rich Cook, winereviewonline.com, May 22, 2018)

Name: J. Lohr Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: There's a reason this Cab is the most popular red in the Vintages Essentials Collection. It's full-bodied and packed with black cherry, blackcurrant, cedar, vanilla and spice. Equally at home with a casual steak sandwich or a thick rib-eye steak.

Name: J. Lohr Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: There's a reason this Cab is the most popular red in the VINTAGES Essentials Collection. It's full bodied and packed with black cherry, blackcurrant, cedar, vanilla and spice. Equally at home with a casual steak sandwich or a thick rib-eye steak.
Recomm_foods: ['Classic Beef Bourguignon', 'Korean-Style Fondue', 'Braised Oxtail with Stewed Eggplant, Red Peppers & Bay Leaf']

Name: J. Lohr Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
Description: Black cherry, smoke and a hint of caramel make for a very familiar and satisfying nose on this well-priced bottling. There is a deep core of black currant fruit, with chalky tannins, a dense mouthfeel and abundant acidity that drives into the finish. Editors' Choice. Score - 90. (Matt Kettman, Wine Enthusiast, Sept. 1, 2018)

Name: J. Vidal Fleury Cote-Rotie Brune & Blonde 2015
Description: The nose of this medium-bodied Syrah is a complex mixture of grilled meat, blackberry, and black pepper.The palate is layered with red fruit and spice which lingers on a medium-long finish with velvety tannins.

Name: J. Vidal-Fleury Chateauneuf-du-Pape 2013
Description: Complex aromas of red fruit, spice, and meat, with dominant tones of strawberry and nutmeg on the nose. A mixture of plum and blackberry with roasted cocoa and dried strawberry carry onto the palate for a lingering, well-balanced finish with smooth tannins.

Name: J. Vidal-Fleury Cornas 2016
Description: This is a dark, structured wine offering a nose of plum, grilled meat, and dry banana with some floral undertones. The palate is a fresh, full bodied mixture of red fruit, pepper, and cured meat. A long finish with dense tannins makes this wine a perfect pairing for grilled red meat and game.

Name: J. Vidal-Fleury Cote Rotie La Chatollonne Blonde 2009
Description: The nose is a mixture of nutmeg, hazelnut, chocolate, and red fruit. These fruity tones translate to the palate with distinct flavours of plum, redcurrant, and coffee. The finish is long and satisfying with powerful tannins and a balanced acidity. Can be opened now but will reward patient cellaring.

Name: J. Vidal-Fleury Gigondas 2016
Description: 'Intensely ripe yet finessed, this big-bodied Gigondas offers luscious blackberry and cherry flavors shaded by brushstrokes of earth, garrigue and violet. It's silky yet brisk with a transparency of crushed minerals brightening the finish. Fine, firm tannins lend structure. Enjoy now-2030.' (Score 94. Wine Enthusiast, November 2018)

Name: J.L. Chave Sélection Mon Coeur Côtes du Rhône 2016
Description: Lurid ruby. Ripe cherries and red berry liqueur on the deeply perfumed, spice-tinged nose. Shows impressive power and breadth on the palate, offering rich black raspberry and bitter cherry flavors complicated by hints of lavender and peppery spices. The smooth, gently tannic finish delivers solid punch and repeating red berry and floral notes. Drinking Window: 2020-2026.  Score - 91. (Josh Raynolds, vinous.com, April 2018)

Name: J.P. Chenet Cabernet Syrah Organic Pays D'OC
Description: A charming, easy-drinking red from the south of France. This is one of the world's best-selling French wines. Appearance is a youthful, ruby red colour. Shows an intense nose of red fruit and black currant with delicate licorice, herb and spice notes. Dry, medium bodied, with supple tannin and spiced, ripe fruit flavours.
Recomm_foods: ['Sautéed Mushrooms with Cheese Fondue Sauce', 'Sesame Ginger Meatball Soup', 'Rhubarb Khoresh']

Name: J.P. Chenet Pinot Noir Reserve VdFrance
Description: Value priced pinot noir. Deep ruby red colour.  Lively aromas of ripe strawberry, sweet cherry and raspberry with light spice and floral/leafy notes. Dry, mid-weight, with soft tannins and a fresh, fruity palate leading to. flavours of tangy red fruit, plum and cherry pie with spicy/peppery, cocoa notes on the finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Spinach Salad with Stuffed Mushrooms', 'Grilled Chicken Fettuccine in Creamy White-Wine Sage Sauce', 'Grilled Duck Breasts with Elderberry & Balsamic Sauce']

Name: J.P. Chenet Premier De Cuvee Merlot Cabernet Pays D'OC
Description: Medium dark red ruby colour; aromas of black berry and spice; dry, medium bodied, with rich fruit centre and good structure.
Recomm_foods: ['Lamb Burgers with Grilled Asparagus & Tzatziki', 'Flank Steak with Kale and Bulgur Salad', 'Skillet Cheeseburger Pizza']

Name: J.Vidal-Fleury Cote-Rotie Brune & Blonde 2015
Description: The nose of this medium-bodied Syrah is a complex mixture of grilled meat, blackberry, and black pepper. The palate is layered with red fruit and spice which lingers on a medium-long finish with velvety tannins.

Name: Jackson-Triggs Cabernet Merlot Proprietors' Selection
Description: Deep ruby; aromas of raspberry, cherry, blackberry, cassis and pepper; medium sweetness and medium body with flavours of soft red fruit and spice.

Name: Jackson-Triggs Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Light to medium ruby garnet colour; dry and medium bodied with lively crisp cassis berry character and very light tannins.
Recomm_foods: ['Lamb Tagine', 'Lamb from Puglia', 'Noisette of Lamb with Cabernet Sauvignon Sauce']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Light to medium ruby garnet colour; dry and medium bodied with lively crisp cassis berry character and very light tannins.
Recomm_foods: ['Tandoori Leg of Lamb with Cucumber Salsa and Mango Ginger Chutney', 'Lamb from Puglia', 'Blackened Lamb']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Light to medium ruby garnet colour; dry and medium bodied with lively crisp cassis berry character and very light tannins.
Recomm_foods: ['Lamb on a Bed of Herbs', 'Lamb Triangoli with Brown Butter & Parmesan', 'Scottish-Style Leg of Lamb']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Grand Reserve Merlot 2016
Description: The sunny 2016 vintage was outstanding in Ontario, particularly for big red wines such as this Merlot. It's rich, ripe and intense, with suggestions of juicy blackberry, plum, cocoa, toasty vanilla and toffee all wrapped in velvety tannins. The finish is lovely and long. Pair with beef short ribs. (Vintages panel, Sept. 2018)

Name: Jackson-Triggs Merlot
Description: The smoothness of merlot is allowed to shine in this single varietal expression. Starts with bright ruby colour, followed by aromas of blackberry, mocha and ripe plums. The fruit flavours resonate on the palate, which is dry and soft with a pleasing finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Lamb, Sausage Bean Witches’ Brew', 'Lamb & Halloumi Pizza', 'Lamb Steaks with Red Pepper Confit']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Merlot
Description: The smoothness of merlot is allowed to shine in this single varietal expression. Starts with bright ruby colour, followed by aromas of blackberry, mocha and ripe plums. The fruit flavours resonate on the palate, which is dry and soft with a pleasing finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Braised Brisket', 'Grilled Striploin', 'Roast Sirloin of Beef']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Merlot
Description: The smoothness of merlot is allowed to shine in this single varietal expression. Starts with bright ruby colour, followed by aromas of blackberry, mocha and ripe plums. The fruit flavours resonate on the palate, which is dry and soft with a pleasing finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Grilled Hanger Steak from Parma', 'Grilled Striploin', 'Low-and-Slow Spiced Brisket Sandwiches']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Niagara Estate Grand Reserve Shiraz 2012
Description: A sweet nose of cinnamon, clove and grilled meat seasoning. The palate is caressing with the tannins and acids both being fairly soft and easy. The finish brings angel food cake with strawberries. Drink over the next couple years. Score - 88. (Brad Royale, winealign.com, Sept. 30, 2014)

Name: Jackson-Triggs Proprietors' Selection Smooth Red
Description: The 1.5 litre format is ideal for large gatherings. Jackson-Triggs Proprietors' Selection Smooth Red Blend has forward jammy notes of plum, blackberry and cassis with a touch of smoke and spice. Enjoy with grilled steak or a bacon cheeseburger.

Name: Jackson-Triggs Reserve Cabernet Franc Cabernet Sauvignon VQA
Description: Medium ruby colour; aromas of red cherry, earth, cracked pepper and toasted oak; on the palate it is dry and medium bodied with flavours of bright red fruit, earth and vanilla with dusty, dry tannins.
Recomm_foods: ['Mini Burgers', 'Lamb Fillets with Candied Onions, Fennel and Canadian Whisky', 'Lamb with Warm Spices and Dates']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Reserve Cabernet Shiraz VQA
Description: Medium ruby; moderate aromas of raspberry, cranberry, blackberry and spice; dry and full body with flavours of dark berries, plum, pepper, cassis and a smoky finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Spaghetti with Braciola', 'Beef and Horseradish Open Sandwiches', 'Brisket from Barque Smokehouse']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Reserve Meritage VQA
Description: Bright ruby/cherry colour; smoky, raspberry, herbaceous/leafy; bell pepper aromas; dry, medium-full body, with good tannic structure; bell pepper and herbal fruit flavours.
Recomm_foods: ['Individual Beef and Stout Pie', 'Perfect Grilled Steak', 'Beef Bourguignon']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Reserve Merlot VQA
Description: Medium ruby red colour; aromas and flavours of cassis, cherry and herb with light oak notes; dry, medium bodied, medium tannin and good acidity on finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Lamb Leg', 'Beef Kefta in Pita', 'Baked Lamb Samosas']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Reserve Rich & Robust Red VQA
Description: This Jackson-Triggs wine is bursting with aromas and flavours of black currants, raspberry, mocha and a hint of wood spice. It's full-bodied, dry and a perfect pairing for barbecue steak with rosemary roasted potatoes.
Recomm_foods: ['Tandoori Rack of Lamb', 'Swanky Shepherd’s Pie', 'Lamb Steaks with Red Pepper Confit']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Shiraz
Description: Deep purple/ruby colour;  soft fruity aromas of plums, cherries, and blackberries; dry, medium body, easy drinking style
Recomm_foods: ['Ale-Braised Short Ribs', 'Roasted Flank Steak with Parmesan Panko Stuffing', 'Beef Bourguignon']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Shiraz
Description: Deep purple/ruby colour;  soft fruity aromas of plums, cherries, and blackberries; dry, medium body, easy drinking style
Recomm_foods: ['New York Sirloin Roast with Pinot & Marrow Sauce', 'Mustard Glazed Standing Rib Roast with Pinot Noir, Balsamic Sauce', 'Beef Tenderloin & Rosemary Oven-Dried tomato Spaghettini']

Name: Jackson-Triggs Shiraz
Description: Deep purple/ruby colour;  soft fruity aromas of plums, cherries, and blackberries; dry, medium body, easy drinking style
Recomm_foods: ['Deep-In-The-Heart-Of-Texas Chili', 'Tri Tip Steak', 'Grilled Beets & Peppercorn-Beef Roast with Gorgonzola Sauce']

Name: Jacob's Creek Double Barrel Shiraz
Description: Deep ruby/purple colour; pronounced aromas of black fruit, toasted oak, crushed mint and eucalyptus; dry, with full body and lush tannins; flavours of blackberry and black cherry, with herbal and toasted oak notes; the finish is medium in length, with some warmth on the palate; drink now or cellar for two to three years.
Recomm_foods: ['Papas Rellena with Aji Picante', 'BBQ Brisket Sandwiches with Sun-Dried Tomato Sauce', 'Grilled Sirloin of Beef with Bagna Cauda Butter']

Name: Jacob's Creek Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon Limestone Coast
Description: The unique soils and gentle climate of Australia's Limestone Coast region create some of Australia's finest red wines. Jacob's Creek Reserve is full-bodied and smooth, with aromas and flavours of blackberry, plum, herbs and eucalyptus. Spicy vanilla and oak notes emerge on a lengthy finish. Serve with grilled flank steak.
Recomm_foods: ['Steak Pizzaiolo Pasta Bake', 'Grilled Hangar Steak', 'Rare Roast Beef with Niçoise Mayonnaise']

Name: Jacob's Creek Reserve Shiraz
Description: Opaque dark red; aromas of cedar, anice, black fruit; black fruit flavours with a toasty medium-long finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Brisket from Barque Smokehouse', 'Ale-Braised Short Ribs', 'Spicy Red Curried Beef with Spinach']

Name: Jacob's Creek Shiraz
Description: Deep ruby red colour; plummy, black cherry aromas with spice and dill accents; dry, full bodied, with moderate tannins and light berry fruit flavours.
Recomm_foods: ['Pulled Beef Ragu Buns', 'Rare Roast Beef with Niçoise Mayonnaise', 'Slow-Cooked Beef Short Ribs']

Name: Jacob's Creek Shiraz Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Legendary in South Eastern Australia, Jacob's Creek presents a modern expression of the classic Aussie blend of shiraz and cabernet. Expect aromas of cassis, mint and vanilla. The palate is dry, with berry flavours leading to a vanilla and toasty oak finish. Serve with ribeye steak, or lamb burgers with grilled mushrooms.
Recomm_foods: ['Mustard Herb Prime Rib Roast with Red Wine Gravy', 'Fried Beef Bulgogi', 'Brisket from Barque Smokehouse']

Name: Jacob's Creek Shiraz Cabernet Sauvignon
Description: Legendary in South Eastern Australia, Jacob's Creek presents a modern expression of the classic Aussie blend of shiraz and cabernet. Expect aromas of cassis, mint and vanilla. The palate is dry, with berry flavours leading to a vanilla and toasty oak finish. Serve with ribeye steak, or lamb burgers with grilled mushrooms.
Recomm_foods: ['Seared Beef Tenderloin with Porcini-Pinot Noir Broth, Crispy Potato Sticks & Green Herb Aïoli', 'Beef Tenderloin', 'Chili Beef Pot Roast with Corn & Peppers']

Name: Jacques AOP Languedoc Red 2015
Description: Ruby red with purple reflections. Aromas of red fruits, especially cranberry and blackcurrant combined with notes of sweet spices bringing a beautiful complexity and a Mediterranean style. A gourmand and round mouth, reminiscent of the red fruits appreciated on the nose, with acidulated notes that bring a beautiful freshness.

Name: Jamsheed Beechworth Syrah 2015
Description: Juicy and vibrant, featuring a mouthwatering mix of huckleberry, wild blueberry and boysenberry flavours at the core. Features plush, velvety tannins, with sage, cinnamon, Earl Grey tea and white pepper details that linger effusively on the long, intense finish. Drink now through 2026.

Name: Jamsheed Ma Petite Francine Cabernet Franc 2017
Description: A beautiful combination of seductive flavour and aroma perfectly suited to a lazy Sunday afternoon, the Harem Ma Petite Francine is a captivating Cabernet contessa. Drawn from a single plot of Yarra Valley Coldstream Cabernet, the Petite Francine Cabernet Franc - a varietal to Cabernet Sauvignon what Pinot Noir is to Shiraz - is both an early-drinking and easy-drinking light red for the purest Cab Franc fanatic. Unfiltered, unfined and with a fruity and herbaceous body.

Name: Janzen Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Description: Medium garnet-purple colored, the 2015 Janzen Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon delivers gorgeous plums preserves, black currant cordial and blackberry pie scents with hints of pencil shavings, baking spices, dried mulberries and raisin cake. Very big, rich and full-bodied in the mouth, the palate is laden with fruit cake and dried berry flavors sparked by spicy accents and framed with soft, fine-grained tannins, finishing very long with a provocative mineral hint. 171 cases were made. Drink Date: 2021-2042. Score - 95. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Dec. 28, 2018)

Name: Janzen Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
Description: The 2013 Janzen Cabernet Sauvignon Beckstoffer To Kalon easily lives up to the first-growth reputation of this great terroir in Oakville. Produced from clone 337, this is truly profound stuff. It has an inky purple color with notes of charcoal embers interwoven with blueberry and blackberry liqueur, forest floor and white flowers. This wine was aged 27 months in 100% new Taransaud cooperage and has fabulous texture, richness and well-integrated oak tannin, alcohol and acidity. Drink it now as well as over the next 30+ years. Drink Date: 2016-2046.  Score - 96. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Oct. 28, 2016)

Name: Jasper Hill Georgia's Paddock Shiraz 2013
Description: Dusty, firm, powerful: just a few apt descriptors for this vintage of one of Heathcote's top wines. Mocha, licorice and blackberries feature on the nose, while the palate delivers more of the same - dark fruit, chocolate and plenty of spice. Best after 2020. Cellar Selection. #66 in 2016 Best of Year. Score - 95. (Joe Czerwinski, Wine Enthusiast, Oct. 2016)

Name: Jaszbery Szekszardi Kekfrankos
Description: Clear deep ruby colour; subtle aromas of cherry, soft floral and spice; dry and medium bodied, aromas repeat on the palate, light cherry, spice and soft floral; short finish.
Recomm_foods: ['Duck Confit with Braised Lentils', 'Duck and Ginger Wonton Soup', 'Duck Legs Braised in Syrah with Plums, Vanilla & Anise']

Name: JC Cellars St. Peter's Church Zinfandel 2013
Description: A full-blooded California red, it reverberates with dense fruit and sweet tannins. Look for a balanced backbone of blackberry and pepper at the core, as the powerful, full-bodied attack surges and then subsides on an unforgettable finish.

Name: JCB Passion Cabernet Sauvignon/Petit Verdot 2015
Description: A blend of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Petit Verdot, the deep garnet-purple colored 2015 JCB Passion Proprietary Red opens with a crème de cassis, char-grilled meat, garrigue and sautéed herbs-scented nose with notions of Indian spices, pepper and potpourri plus a touch of yeast extract. The medium-bodied palate is elegant, fresh, floral and finely textured, finishing long with some spices coming through. Drink Date: 2017-2035. Score - 94. (Lisa Perrotti-Brown, MW, robertparker.com, Dec. 29, 2017)

Name: Jean Claude Mas Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot Reserve Pays d'Oc
Description: Medium ruby colour; aromas of blueberry, ripe plum, and dark cherry; extra dry, medium-bodied, good acidity and balanced with light tannin; flavours of plum, smoke and blackberry; long finish.

Name: Jean Monnier Beaune 1er cru Montrevenots 2016
Description: A family domaine since 1720. The Montrevenots plot is located in the southern part of Beaune near the village of Pommard. A powerful red wine that will reward a few more years of bottle age.

Name: Jean Perrier & Fils Cuvée Gastronomie Mondeuse Savoie 2015
Description: Mondeuse is an ancient grape and long associated with Savoie, which lies east of Beaujolais and abuts the Swiss border. Recent DNA profiling has determined that Mondeuse is a close relative of Syrah. This example offers a fine demonstration of the variety's characteristic aromatic nature. Black cherry, licorice and fresh cracked pepper make for a delightfully complex and layered experience, and the grape's noted acidity is well represented here. Structured, balanced and long, this will be a fine match for grilled lamb. (Vintages panel, Aug. 2016)

Name: Jean-Claude Boisset Clos De La Roche Grand Cru 2016
Description: A very impressive wine that delivers a wealth of rich red cherries and dark cherries, as well as plums, violets and earthy nuances. A very smooth and plush palate that has an incredibly pure, supple and focused array of vibrant cherry flavors, all encased in fine, long tannins. An elegant, seamless and stylish Burgundy. Drink from 2021. Score - 97-98. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 15, 2018)

Name: Jean-Claude Boisset Ladoix Hautes Mourottes 1er Cru 2016
Description: Some attractive graphite and stony notes with an almost tarry edge. The ripe dark cherries have real depth and power. Very intense, long and good. Drink or hold for 10 more years. Score - 92-93. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Feb. 15, 2018)

Name: Jean-Claude Boisset Les Ursulines Bourgogne Pinot Noir 2016
Description: A smoky version, offering black cherry, blackberry, earth and spice flavors to match the toasty oak. This is succulent and leaves spice and smoke notes on the finish. Drink now through 2021.  Score - 90. (Bruce Sanderson, winespectator.com, May 31, 2018)

Name: Jean-Ernest Descombes Morgon 2016
Description: Vivid ruby. Powerful cherry and black raspberry aromas, complicated by floral and smoky mineral nuances. Juicy black raspberry and bitter cherry flavors offer an appealing blend of richness and vivacity and turn sweeter with air. Smoky and penetrating on the finish, which shows excellent clarity and strong, floral- and mineral-tinged persistence. Drinking Window: 2021-2026. Score - 91. (Josh Raynolds, vinous.com, Oct. 2017)

Name: Jean-Luc Baldès Clos Triguedina Les Galets Malbec 2008
Description: Using fruit sourced from a single vineyard with great sun exposure, this wine takes its name from the stony soil. It provides great balance between the dense black fruit and the taut, minerally texture, expressing the essence of Malbec in Cahors. It certainly needs several years of aging. Editors' Choice.   Score - 95. (Roger Voss, Wine Enthusiast, March 2013)

Name: Jean-Pierre Moueix Bordeaux 2015
Description: No rough edges, all smooth sailing. A plummy (skins, juice and flesh) red of brambly, dark berry fruit perfume and subtle clove-like oak character. The palate is sweet fruit cupped in silty, cedary tannin, finishing succulent and faintly twiggy. It's a beautiful drink in its simplicity and clarity. A no brainer for long lunches and sipping fireside. Drink: 2017-2028. Score - 90. (Mike Bennie, winefront.com.au, June 2017)

Name: Jeanneret Cabernet/Malbec 2016
Description: This is delectably expressed on the nose showing creme de cassis, mixed berry compote, cedar, violet, game and cocoa characters. It is wonderfully fruited and generous on the palate, delivering powerful fruit flavours backed by supple mouthfeel and chalky tannins. Mouthfilling and expansive with a persistent silky finish. At its best: 2019 to 2026. Score - 94. (Sam Kim, wineorbit.co.nz, April 2018)

Name: Jeff Cohn Cellars Cassata Vineyard Zinfandel 2014
Description: I tasted a half-dozen Zinfandel-based cuvées from Jeff Cohn - and all of them merit serious attention from wine consumers. The 2014 Zinfandel Cassata Vineyard is 75% Zinfandel and 25% Petite Sirah with 15% whole clusters. This is a killer Zinfandel with floral notes, loads of blackberry and blackcurrant fruit, medium to full-bodied and, somehow, hiding all of its high-octane 15.6% alcohol. Stunningly floral, rich, full-bodied and compelling, this is a stunner to drink over the next 7-8 years. Drink Date: 2016-2024. Score - 95. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2016 )

Name: Jeff Cohn Cellars Domaine des Chirats Rockpile Vineyard Syrah 2014
Description: The 2014 Syrah Domaine Des Chirats comes from Rockpile. It is a collaboration with Yves Cuilleron from France's Northern Rhône. This is made from what is believed to be Chapoutier suitcase clones. It is 100% Syrah aged in about 30% new French oak with about 30% whole clusters during the fermentation. Beautiful elegance and complexity with notes of blueberry, blackberry, floral notes, and great acid, this is a dead ringer for a Northern Hermitage or Côte-Rôtie. A gorgeous, dense purple color to the rim, sweet, juicy fruit, full body, but again, incredible freshness and vibrancy. This is a stunner and comes in at 15.2% natural alcohol, but seems light on its feet. Drink it over the next decade or more. P.S. As it sits in the glass, some bacon fat, lard and meaty notes also emerge. Drink Date: 2016-2026. Score - 95. (Robert Parker Jr., robertparker.com, Dec. 30, 2016 )

Name: Jermann Red Angel on the Moonlight 2016
Description: A light and fresh pinot noir with strawberry and floral aromas and flavors. Medium body. Crisp finish. Drink now.  Score - 90. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, June 16, 2019)

Name: Jerzu Marghia Cannonau di Sardegna 2017
Description: Intense notes of minerals, pumice and black tea highlight the dark fruit aromas. Full body, round and chewy tannins and an energized, fruity finish. Reserved and very beautiful. Drink now. Score - 92. (James Suckling, jamessuckling.com, Oct. 22, 2018)

Name: Jeunesse Cabernet Sauvignon KPM
Description: Plum, prune, spice and black cherry. Grilled meats and vegetables.

Name: Jim Barry Cover Drive Cabernet Sauvignon 2014
Description: This is a terrific value in balanced, ready-to-drink Australian Cabernet. It brings several Bordeaux-ish qualities to the table - medium body, silky tannins and aromas reminiscent of cigar box and Ribena - then adds varietally true flavors and a long finish. Drink now-2025. Editors' Choice.  Score - 91. (Joe Czerwinski, Wine Enthusiast, April 1, 2017)

Name: Jim Barry The Armagh Shiraz 2014
Description: The star of the Jim Barry show - it plays a different medley. This is superbly honed, brimming with power and depth, full-bodied yet there's a certain refinement too.
